title: Maud
data:

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Location](#Location)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 Trivia](#Trivia)
- [5 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Maud the Forgotten** is a [unique](/Unique "Unique") melee fighter whose only notable trait is a tendency toward wielding powerful weapons. She can also spawn in (enchanted) heavy armour, with a wand, ring and potion.

## Location

- [The Dungeon](/The_Dungeon "The Dungeon"):10-14
- [The Lair](/The_Lair "The Lair"):3-8
- The [Orcish Mines](/Orcish_Mines "Orcish Mines"):2-4

## Tips & Tricks

Maud is a spell-less warrior, so attack her from afar. She is not very dangerous in melee either; she has decent damage and a good weapon, but is only normal speed with poor [AC](/AC "AC") and [EV](/EV "EV"). Check her weapon to see if it's any good; demon weaponry is often very useful in the mid-game, especially if it's nicely branded.

The whole situation may change drastically if her armour gives her resistance against your primary source of damage (say, fire resistance versus your fire spells), the wand happens to be one of acid, the ring allowing her to go invisible and the potion being one of might, haste or berserk rage.

## Trivia

Maud is a reference to the [scroll of amnesia](/Scroll_of_amnesia "Scroll of amnesia") found in [NetHack](http://www.nethack.org/), a competing roguelike. When the [scroll](/Scroll "Scroll") is read, in addition to causing maprot and ID-rot, it produces messages referring to Maud, the name itself being a reference to the [Alfred Tennyson poem](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maud_%28poem%29) of the same name.

## History

Maud was removed in [0.19](/0.19 "0.19")

Maud

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Maud @ 
HP 77-156
HD 13
XP 1739
Speed 10
AC 10
EV 7
Will 80
Attack1 32 (hit: plain)


Resistances None
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type human, human
Flags Fighter
Speaks
Warm-blooded
Unique
Female
A mysterious warrior princess from a far-off kingdom, on a quest to retrieve the legendary sword ‘Entarex’. Countless have been the admirers who, thinking about Maud, forgot everything else.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Location
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 Trivia
  • 5 History

Useful Info

Maud the Forgotten is a unique melee fighter whose only notable trait is a tendency toward wielding powerful weapons. She can also spawn in (enchanted) heavy armour, with a wand, ring and potion.

Location

  • The Dungeon:10-14
  • The Lair:3-8
  • The Orcish Mines:2-4

Tips & Tricks

Maud is a spell-less warrior, so attack her from afar. She is not very dangerous in melee either; she has decent damage and a good weapon, but is only normal speed with poor AC and EV. Check her weapon to see if it's any good; demon weaponry is often very useful in the mid-game, especially if it's nicely branded.

The whole situation may change drastically if her armour gives her resistance against your primary source of damage (say, fire resistance versus your fire spells), the wand happens to be one of acid, the ring allowing her to go invisible and the potion being one of might, haste or berserk rage.

Trivia

Maud is a reference to the scroll of amnesia found in NetHack, a competing roguelike. When the scroll is read, in addition to causing maprot and ID-rot, it produces messages referring to Maud, the name itself being a reference to the Alfred Tennyson poem of the same name.

History

Maud was removed in 0.19

==Location==

==Tips & Tricks==
Maud is a spell-less warrior, so attack her from afar. She is not very dangerous in melee either; she has decent damage and a good weapon, but is only normal speed with poor [[AC]] and [[EV]]. Check her weapon to see if it's any good; demon weaponry is often very useful in the mid-game, especially if it's nicely branded.

The whole situation may change drastically if her armour gives her resistance against your primary source of damage (say, fire resistance versus your fire spells), the wand happens to be one of acid, the ring allowing her to go invisible and the potion being one of might, haste or berserk rage.
